10/29/20-- Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff sampled the East Shore of  Mystic Lake on October 22, 2020. High levels of Microcystin within the Danger Advisory levels according to the Trigger Levels for Human and Animal Health were detected with the highest concentration 30 times above danger threshold. It is recommended that a Danger Advisory sign be posted at the duck blinds on the east side of Mystic Lake.

WaterBodyName: Putah Creek south of Davis campus down old Davis Road
IncidentInformation:
Update: Water Board staff collected sample of algal mats on 11/4. Lab results indicate that the algal mats are comprised of algae and no cyanobacteria observed. 

On 11/2/202 the Water Boards received a report of algal mats growing in Putah Creek. Attached algal mats can harbor toxic algae. The Water Boards is conducting a field investigation and will update this record when more information becomes available. Avoid touching or ingesting any algal biomass, especially for dogs and children.

WaterBodyName: Barry Creek, tributary to Mad River and Ruth Lake
IncidentInformation:
11/13/2020: Samples collected on 11/6 showed 0.16 ug/L of microcystin in the creek water. Toxins are being produced in attached algal mats. Caution advisory remains and we recommend avoiding contact with algal mat material. 

11/6/2020: Trinity County officials have warned people of potential contamination to drinking water pulled from Barry Creek a tributary to Mad River and Ruth Lake. The recommendation is to DO NOT DRINK and DO NOT BOIL drinking water until further notice. For questions please contact Trinity County Environmental Health at (530) 623-1459.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Barry Creek, tributary to Mad River and Ruth Lake

IncidentInformation: Report of suspected bloom at the lake describing green discolored water and potential illness. The report is under investigation.

WaterBodyName: Prado Park Lake - Prado Regional Park
IncidentInformation: 11/23/2020-San Bernardino County Park Staff sampled Prado Regional Park Lake on November 16, 2020. Results detected that the level of microcystin in the lake has decreased from the Danger Advisory to the Caution Advisory. Staff will be removing the Danger advisory signs and replacing with Caution instead.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Prado Park Lake - Prado Regional Park

WaterBodyManager: Bel Marin Keys Community Services District
IncidentInformation: On 12/16/20 report submitted describing a algae bloom at Bel Marin Keys, specifically the northern and southern lagoons. The water manager has collected samples for testing and distributed flyers to the residents to inform them of water conditions.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Bel Marin Keys north and south lagoons

East Bay Regional Park District conducts routine cyanobacteria bloom monitoring at this lake or shoreline location. This lake is currently closed to swimming due to Shelter in Place mandate. For more info, go to: https://www.ebparks.org/about/stewardship/water/cyanobacteria_(blue_green_algae)_updates.htm
The 2021 routine monitoring results are provided below:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On 12/29/21, this weeks storms stirred up sediment around the lake, making cyanobacteria observation difficult. No visible cyanobacteria were observed near the woodbridge, at the north buoy, or at the swim beach.

December 10th: All Lake Anza cyanobacteria advisories were removed.

On 12/8/21, the waters of Lake Anza were dark colored, and there is duckweed and Azolla fern clustered along the dam face, the east shore and creating swirls throughout the lake, but no cyanobacteria was visible in the water column. On 12/10/21, no cyanobacteria were observed at the dam or swim beach. A sample from the swim beach was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detect. Advisory removal pending.

On 11/29/21, the waters of Lake Anza were still brown. No visible cyanobacteria were observed. 

On 11/17/21, the waters of Lake Anza are slightly less murky, though they are still brown. No visible cyanobacteria were observed. A sample from the swim area was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detect. 

On 11/12/21, the waters of Lake Anza remain murky and brown, but regardless of the difficult observation conditions, very few specks of Microcystis-type cyanobacteria were observed dispersed in the water column at the north buoy.

On 11/5/21, like last week, the lake was chocolate-milk-brown making visual observation difficult. No visible cyanobacteria were observed at the north buoy, swim beach, nor around the Wildcat Creek inflow to the lake. A Caution Advisory was posted earlier this week based on last weeks recommendations.

East Bay Regional Park District conducts routine cyanobacteria bloom monitoring at this lake or shoreline location. For more info, go to: https://www.ebparks.org/about/stewardship/water/cyanobacteria_(blue_green_algae)_updates.htm

The 2021 routine monitoring results are provided below:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On 12/29/21, this weeks storms stirred up sediment around the lake, making cyanobacteria observation difficult. No visible cyanobacteria were observed near the woodbridge, at the north buoy, or at the swim beach.

On 12/14/21, pea to dime sized Aphanizomenon-type colonies throughout boat launch area. A sample from the boat launch was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detect. Routine raw drinking water intake and finished drinking water samples were collected and tested for Microcystins using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detects. On 12/20/21, scums were along the entire boat launch area. Larger clumps of colonies extended another two feet that turned into suspended colonies past the docks. At the ADA-west dock, scums extended throughout the shoreline weeds and suspended colonies started at the shore and extended out past the dock. Aphanizomenon-type cyanobacteria were dominant with plenty of Dolichospermum-type colonies and a few Microcystis-type colonies in microscope observations. A sample from the boat launch was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in greater than 10 ppb. Another sample from the boat launch was tested for Anatoxin-A, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detect.

On 12/6/21, a few half dollar sized clumps of grass-clipping-like Aphanizomenon-type cyanobacteria and Dolichospermum-type cyanobacteria were observed at the boat launch. Smaller grass clipping like colonies of Aphanizomenon-type were observed suspended throughout the water column at the boat launch and marina. A sample from the boat launch was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detect. 

On 11/24/21, large clumps of grass-clipping-like Aphanizomenon-type cyanobacteria and smaller specks of Microcystis-type and Dolichospermum-type cyanobacteria were observed densely suspended throughout the water column at the boat launch. Smaller clumps and specks of Aphanizomenon-type and Dolichospermum-type cyanobacteria were observed at the east and west swim beaches. A sample from the boat launch was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in greater than 10ppb. On 11/30/21, large green mats with patches of turquoise and white of Aphanizomenon-type, Microcystis-type, and Dolichospermum-type cyanobacteria were observed swirling along the surface of the water at the boat launch. A sample was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in greater than 10 ppb.

On 11/15/21, half-dollar-sized clumps of Aphanizomenon-type and Dolichospermum-type cyanobacteria were observed suspended throughout the water column at the boat launch. A sample from the boat launch was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detect. The same sample was tested for Cylindrospermopsin, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detect.

On 11/9/21, clumps of grass-clipping-like Aphanizomenon-type and Dolichospermum-type cyanobacteria were observed suspended throughout the water column at the boat launch. A sample from the  boat launch was tested, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in a non-detect. Monthly routine samples from the drinking water intake an Building 13 were both tested twice for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kits and Abraxis CAAS, all resulting in non-detects.

On 11/3/21, bloom-like conditions were observed at the boat launch, with Dolichospermum-type, Aphanizomenon-type, Limnoraphis-type, and Microcystis-type cyanobacteria observed in large, thick clumps and suspended specks throughout the water column. Less dense accumulations of the Dolichospermum-type, Aphanizomenon-type, and Limnoraphis-type cyanobacteria types were observed at the east swim beach. Less dense accumulations of the same cyanobacteria types were observed at the west swim beach. A sample from the boat launch was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in greater than 10 ppb. The same boat launch sample was re-tested, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in 23.99 ppb. HABs Danger Advisory Signage has been placed around the lake.

East Bay Regional Park District conducts routine cyanobacteria bloom monitoring at this lake or shoreline location. This lake is currently closed to swimming due to Shelter in Place mandate. For more info, go to: https://www.ebparks.org/about/stewardship/water/cyanobacteria_(blue_green_algae)_updates.htm

The 2021 routine monitoring results are provided below:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On 12/8/21, thick cyanobacteria was observed throughout the Marina. No samples were collected. 

On 11/8/21, a thick, soupy green sheet composed of clumps of Microcystis-type, Woronichinia-type, and Dolichospermum-type cyanobacteria were observed floating along the surface of the water between the kayak launch and the beginning of the marina. Large clumps ranging from dime to nickel sized of the same cyanobacteria types were observed densely suspended throughout the water column throughout the rest of the marina. 

On 11/3/21, waters surrounding the entire marina were green with Microcystis-type, Woronichinia-type, Aphanizomenon-type, Dolichospermum-type, and Limnoraphis-type cyanobacteria, which were observed floating in large clumps along the surface and suspended densely throughout the water column. A sample was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in greater than 50 ppb.

On 10/26/21, small clumps and specks of Microcystis-type and Aphanizomenon-type cyanobacteria were observed floating along the surface and suspended throughout the water column at the marina. Fewer small clumps and specks of Microcystis-type and Woronichinia-type cyanobacteria were observed suspended in the water column surrounding the first fishing dock on the west side of the lake. A sample was from the marina was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in 35.63 ppb. A sample was from the west side dock was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in 2.73 ppb.

On 12/28/21, no visible cyanobacteria were observed at the swim beach or boat launch.

On 12/6/21, no cyanobacteria were observed at the swim beach, boat launch, Shinn or Grau ponds. 

On 12/9/21, cylindrical specks of Oscillatoria-type cyanobacteria were observed in the veliger net.

On 11/23/21, Very few cylindrical specks of Oscillatoria-type cyanobacteria were observed suspended in the water column at the boat launch.

On 11/17/21, Very few cylindrical specks of Limnoraphis-type cyanobacteria were observed suspended in the water column at the boat launch. Small clumps of scum with Limnoraphis-type cyanobacteria trapped within were observed at Lago Los Osos. The water at Grau Pond remains too low and muddy for effective observation. East Bay Regional Park District conducts routine cyanobacteria bloom monitoring at this lake or shoreline location. This lake is currently closed to swimming due to Shelter in Place mandate. For more info, go to: https://www.ebparks.org/about/stewardship/water/cyanobacteria_(blue_green_algae)_updates.htm

The 2021 routine monitoring results are provided below:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On 12/27/21, this weeks storms stirred up sediment around the lake, making cyanobacteria observation difficult. No visible cyanobacteria were observed at the Northwest Dock. 
On 11/22/21, the lake was still brown and murky. No visible cyanobacteria were observed at the northwest dock.

On 11/8/21, no visible cyanobacteria were observed at the swim beach.

On 11/3/21, water management responded to reports of a sewage spill that reached Lake Temescal last week. Cyanobacteria observation was not conducted while responding to the SSO. On 11/5/21, water management received another report of an SSO. The lake has been closed pending sampling results.

On 10/26/21, the lake was chocolate-milk-brown following the weekend storms, making cyanobacteria observation difficult. No visible cyanobacteria were observed at the northwest dock.

IncidentInformation:
East Bay Regional Park District conducts routine cyanobacteria bloom monitoring at this lake or shoreline location. For more info, go to: https://www.ebparks.org/about/stewardship/water/cyanobacteria_(blue_green_algae)_updates.htm

The 2021 routine monitoring results are provided below:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On 12/8/21, no visible cyanobacteria were observed throughout the entire lake. 

On 11/30 /21, small specks of Microcystis-type cyanobacteria were observed at the popular Arroyo dog access area. 

On 11/17 /21, small specks of Microcystis-type and Dolichospermum-type cyanobacteria were observed at the popular Arroyo dog access area. A sample was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in 1 ppb. 

On 11/9/21, fewer specks of Microcystis-type cyanobacteria than last week were observed at the popular Arroyo dog access area. A sample was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in 4.00 ppb. 

On 11/4/21, lots of specks of Woronichinia-type, Microcystis-type, and Dolichospermum-type cyanobacteria were observed at the popular Arroyo dog access area. A sample was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detect. The same sample was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in 7.28 ppb. Caution Advisory signage has been placed around the access area.

The Regional Water Board is conducting routine water monitoring at several sites around the Salton Sea. The results for the Desert Shores site are posted below. For more info, contact cyanoHAB.reports@waterboards.ca.gov.
------------------------------------------------------------
7/06/2021: Three algal mat samples were collected and composited into a single sample. The sample showed detections of saxitoxin, anatoxin-a and cylindrospermopsin.
5/24/2021: water and algal mat samples collected. Due to extensive algal mat proliferation in the area and potential cyanotoxin production warning advisory is recommended and the postings are in process. The water sample detected cylindrospermopsin.

4/12/21: A single water sample was collected for analysis for cyanotoxins. Cylindrospermopsin was detected at a concentration of 0.16 ug/L.
4/5/2021: Report of a dog fatality at the Salton Sea State Recreation Area. Owner reported that the dog had ingested water at the shore and thereafter exhibited a number of symptoms indicative of cyanotoxin exposure.The dog was taken to an emergency animal hospital for treatment, but sadly the animal died two days later on April 7, 2021.
3/16/2021: Water and algal mat samples were collected. Water sample showed low detections of saxitoxin and cylindrospermopsin. Algal mat sample showed low concentration of cylindrospermopsin. 

2/18/2021: Water and scum samples collected. Water samples results detected low concentrations of cyanotoxins. Scum sample detected 1.4 ug/L microcystins, and low detections of cylindrospermopsin and saxitoxin. Recommend posting caution sign.

1/21/21: Water samples collected. Water sample results detected low concentrations of cyanotoxins. Caution advisory not advised based on results.

The Regional Water Board is conducting routine water monitoring at several sites around the Salton Sea. The results for the Desert Shores site are posted below. For more info, contact cyanoHAB.reports@waterboards.ca.gov.

3/16/21: Water and algal mat samples were collected. Water sample showed low concentrations of saxitoxin and cylindrospermopsin. Cyanotoxins were absent in the algal mat.

2/18/2021: Water, scum, and algal mat samples collected. Samples results detected low concentrations of cyanotoxins.  Recommend posting caution sign.

1/21/21: Water and algal mat samples collected. Water sample results detected low concentrations of cyanotoxins. Algal mat samples detected 0.28 ug/L anatoxin-a, and low detections of cylindrospermopsin and microcystins.Recommend posting caution sign, and children and dogs to avoid contact with algal mats.

WaterBodyName: Contra Loma Reservoir, at Regional Park
IncidentInformation:
East Bay Regional Park District conducts routine cyanobacteria bloom monitoring at this lake or shoreline location. For more info, go to: https://www.ebparks.org/about/stewardship/water/cyanobacteria_(blue_green_algae)_updates.htm

The 2021 routine monitoring results are provided below:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On 12/9/21, green specks were collected at the boat launch, but no cyanobacteria were observed under the microscope, and no cyanobacteria were observed along the east shoreline. A sample from the boat launch was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detect.

On 12/3/21, pea-sized clumps and specks of Microcystis-type and grass-like-clipping specks of Aphanizomenon-type cyanobacteria were observed suspended in the water column throughout the lake. A sample was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detect.

On 11/15/21, small specks of Microcystis-type cyanobacteria surrounded by Pseudoanabaena-type cyanobacteria were observed suspended in the water column at the boat launch. During vertical veliger tow sampling near the dam, a high density of algae and the same cyanobacteria types were observed. A sample from the boat launch was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis Strip Test Kit, resulting in a non-detect.

On 11/9/21, few tiny specks of Microcystis-type cyanobacteria were observed suspended in the water column at the west fishing dock that is currently under construction. During vertical veliger tow sampling near the dam, a high density of algae and Microcystis-type cyanobacteria were observed. A sample from the west fishing dock was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in a non-detect. A sample from the veliger tow was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in 7.46 ppb. Danger advisory signage has been posted around the reservoir.

On 11/4/21, no visible cyanobacteria were observed at the boat launch. A sample was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in a non-detect. The reservoir is currently still at a Caution Advisory, but recommendations have been made to take down signage.

On 10/26/21, very fine specks of Microcystis-type cyanobacteria were observed suspended in less density than last week at the boat launch. A sample was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in a non-detect.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Contra Loma Reservoir, at Regional Park

7/06/2021: Three algal mat samples were collected and composited into a single sample. The sample showed detections of (3) cyanotoxins: anatoxin-a, cylindrospremopsin and saxitoxin.
6/30/2021: A single water sample and algal mat sample was collected for analysis. Algal matting covered the fine sediments near shore, appearing as a light to dark green layer. Both the water sample and the sediment sample showed saxitoxin and cylindrospermopsin, with the sediment sample also showing anatoxin-a.
5/24/2021: water and algal mat samples collected. Due to extensive algal mat proliferation in the area and potential cyanotoxin production warning advisory is recommended and the postings are in process. The water sample detected cylindrospermopsin and saxitoxin.

03/16/21: Water, algal mat and scum samples were collected. Water sample results showed low levels of saxitoxin and cylindrospermopsin. Algal mat sample showed no detections of cyanotoxins. Note that a dead dog was found at the water's edge between the sea and a shallow pool covered with green and brown scum. It is NOT known if cyanotoxins played a role in the dog's death, while the scum that was collected from the pool in question was analyzed, showing anatoxin-a at a concentration of 0.30 ug/L

2/18/21: Water and algal mat samples collected. Water sample results detected low concentrations of cyanotoxins. Algal mat sample detected 0.26 ug/L anatoxin. Recommend posting caution sign.

1/21/21: Water and algal mat samples collected. Water and algal mat sample results detected low concentrations of cyanotoxins. Presence of algal mats was confirmed. Recommend posting caution sign, and children and dogs to avoid contact with algal mats.

3/16/21: Water and algal mat samples collected. Anatoxin-a was detected at 0.30 ug/L in the water sample, as well as low detections of saxitoxin and cylindrospermopsin. Anatoxin-a was  detected in algal mat samples at 0.63 ug/L and 0.30 ug/L. Recommend posting caution sign.

2/18/2021: Water, scum, and algal mat samples collected. Water samples results detected low concentrations of cyanotoxins. Algal mat samples detected 0.35 ug/L anatoxin-a, and low detections of cylindrospermopsin and microcystins. Scum sample detected 0.83 ug/L microcystins. Recommend posting caution sign.

1/21/21: Water and algal mat samples collected. Water sample results detected low concentrations of cyanotoxins. Algal mat samples detected 0.42 ug/L anatoxin-a, and low detections of cylindrospermopsin and microcystins. Recommend posting caution sign, and children and dogs to avoid contact with algal mats.

IncidentInformation:
08/12/2021 Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff sampled on 08/05/21 as part as the Lake Elsinore HABs Special Study. Microcystin levels continue to be within the Caution advisory but the data is trending towards the Warning advisory. We currently recommend that the Lake-wide Caution Advisory signs be maintained.

IncidentInformation:
East Bay Regional Park District conducts routine cyanobacteria bloom monitoring at this lake or shoreline location. For more info, go to: https://www.ebparks.org/about/stewardship/water/cyanobacteria_(blue_green_algae)_updates.htm

The 2021 routine monitoring results are provided below:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

On 11/30/21, no visible cyanobacteria were observed throughout the entire lake. 

On 11/17/21, no visible cyanobacteria were observed at the boat launch. 

On 11/9/21, no visible cyanobacteria were observed at the boat launch. 

On 11/4/21, very few strands of Aphanizomenon-type cyanobacteria were observed while conducting a veliger tow at the lake. A sample was tested for Microcystins, using Abraxis CAAS, resulting in a non-detect.

WaterBodyName: Klamath River at Walker Bridge (RM 156.26; Baseline)
IncidentInformation:
See RESULTS below. Klamath Basin Monitoring Program conducts routine monitoring of the Klamath Basin for cyanobacteria and cyanotoxins but due to Covid-19 restrictions, some monitoring activities may be different this year. In the Basin cyanobacteria blooms typically occur between June and October. When water testing indicates that reservoir and river conditions exceed public health recommendations for cyanotoxins, the area is posted with a health advisory sign.

RESULTS:

11/4/2021: Microcystin concentrations were below recommended trigger levels in samples collectd on 10/27. Water Boards data indicate that anatoxin concentrations have likely decreased due to seasonal declines in cyanobacteria growth and benthic mat removal during recent high flow events. The Water Boards does not recommend any postings at this time. 

10/22/2021: Microcystins were detected (0.34 ug/L) in water samples collected on 10/13; these concentrations are below recommended trigger levels. Planktonic Caution still recommended due to previous anatoxin detections in the river.

10/4/2021: Microcystins were detected (0.12 ug/L) in water samples collected on 9/29; these concentrations are below recommended trigger levels. Planktonic Caution still recommended due to previous anatoxin detections in the river.

9/20/2021: Microcystins were not detected in water samples collected on 9/15/2021. Planktonic Caution still recommended due to previous anatoxin detections. 

9/7/2021: Microcystins were detected (0.54 ug/L) in water samples collected on 8/25/2021; these concentrations are below recommended trigger levels. Planktonic Caution still recommended due to previous anatoxin detections. 

8/25/2021: Anatoxins were detected in the water upstream and downstream of this location. Waterboards recommends posting a planktonic Caution sign. 

7/14/2021: Microcystins were detected (0.11 ug/L) but at concentrations that are below recommended trigger levels; no postings. 

7/7/2021: Microcystins were not detected; no postings. 

6/23/2021: Microcystins were not detected; no postings.

6/9/2021: Microcystins were not detected; no postings.

5/26/2021: Microcystins were not detected; no posting.

Klamath Basin Monitoring Program conducts routine monitoring of the Klamath Basin for cyanobacteria and cyanotoxins but due to Covid-19 restrictions, some monitoring activities may be different this year. In the Basin, cyanobacteria blooms typically occur between June and October. When water testing indicates that reservoir and river conditions exceed public health recommendations for cyanotoxins, the area is posted with a health advisory sign.

8/26/2021: Regional Board conducted monitoring at main marina launch on 8/18 as part of the pre-holiday assessment. Microcystins were detected below the caution advisory level of 0.8 ug/L and no visual observations of a bloom. No advisory recommended. 

5/27/2021: Regional Board conducted monitoring at Marina launch and day use area. Cyanotoxins were non-detect and no cyanobacteria observed by microscope. No advisory recommended. 

5/25/2021: County conducted monitoring near the intake at the surface of the lake on 5/18. No visual indicators of a bloom were observed.

8/26/2021: Sample was collected by Regional Board staff on 8/19 at the boat dock near lake side trail for the pre-holiday assessment. Cyanotoxins were present but below the cuation advisory threshold and no visible indicators of a bloom were present. No advisory recommended. 

5/27/2021: Regional Board conducted monitoring at boat dock near lake side trail. Low levels of microcystins were detected (below recreational trigger levels) and no cyanobacteria observed by microscope. No advisory recommended.

12/08/2021: The County of San Luis Obispo Parks and Recreation Department conducts regular monitoring at Lopez Lake. Cell counts per mL for blue-green algae were zero. No advisory recommended.

9/30/2021: The County of San Luis Obispo Parks and Recreation Department conducts regular monitoring at Lopez Lake. Due to some higher cells per mL for green-blue algae, caution advisory has been posted. 

8/26/2021: Regional Board conducted monitoring at kayak rental dock and Cottonwood Cove. Low levels of microcystins were detected (below recreational trigger levels). Anatoxin-a was detected at 0.25 ug/L. Caution advisory recommended. 

5/27/2021: Regional Board conducted monitoring at kayak rental dock and Cottonwood Cove. Low levels of microcystins were detected (below recreational trigger levels) and no cyanobacteria observed by microscope. No advisory recommended. 

5/25/2021: County conducts routine monitoring near a intake and boat docks. No visual indicators of a bloom were observed on 5/19/2021.

8/26/2021: Regional Board conducted monitoring on 8/18 at the Harris Creek boat launch. Microcystins were detected below the 0.8 ug/L advisory level and visual observations of a bloom were observed. No advisory recommended.

5/27/2021: Regional Board conducted monitoring at the south shore marina launch and beach. Cyanotoxins were non-detect and low amount of cyanobacteria observed by microscope. No advisory recommended.

RecLandManager: CA Dept. of Fish and Wildlife
IncidentInformation:
This area is posted permanently with danger advisory.

The Dept. of Fish and Wildlife and Water Boards have monitored this area since HABs occurred in summer of 2017. Based on the monitoring data collected since this time, the water manager posted permanent danger advisory in winter 2020 due to the frequent cyanobacteria blooms near the shore and has discontinued water monitoring.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Huichica Creek Unit, Pond 8, Napa-Sonoma Marshes Wildlife Area

IncidentInformation:
07/2/21-Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board Staff took samples on 6/22/21 as part of the ongoing HABs Special Study. Levels of microcystin were detected. Due to the visual indicators as well as the levels of QPCR, staff reccommends a lake-wide Caution Advisory be posted.   

3/02/2021: Santa Ana Water Board staff sampled Big Bear Lake on February 17, 2021. A surface water sample as well as an algal mat sample were taken with results of Microcystin above the Caution level Cylindrospermopsin was also detected both in the algal mat and the surface water sample.

2/18/2021: Regional Water Board staff collected water samples at multiple points around the lake. Lab results are pending.

2/3/2021: Regional Water Board staff observed algal mats and water discoloration along the shoreline at Stanfield Cutoff - northern end. Coordination of water sampling at the lake is underway to investigation water conditions.

9/2/2021: Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff sampled on 08/24/21 as part as the Lake Elsinore HABs Special Study. Water Boards recommend that the Lake-wide Caution Advisory signs be maintained. 

08/12/2021 Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff sampled on 08/05/21 as part as the Lake Elsinore HABs Special Study. Microcystin levels continue to be within the Caution advisory but the data is trending towards the Warning advisory. We currently recommend that the Lake-wide Caution Advisory signs be maintained. 

6/25/21: Water monitoring conducted on 6/17 confirmed cyanobacteria bloom and low levels of cyanotoxins. Caution advisory continues. 

6/15: Water monitoring conducted on 6/2 confirmed cyanobacteria bloom and low levels of cyanotoxins. Lake wide Caution advisory continues. 

5/28/21-Samples were collected by Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board Staff on 5/18/21 as part of an ongoing Special Study. Due to lab results and  visual indicators, Water Boards recommend that the lake-wide Caution Advisory be maintained.

02/16/21:  City of Lake Elsinore staff continue to keep signage around the lake at the Caution level. HAB occurrence continues from 2020. Also, Satellite imagery indicates that the lakewide cyanobacteria bloom continues at Lake Elsinore.

Microcystin levels continue to be within the Caution advisory but the data is trending towards the Warning advisory. We currently recommend that the Lake-wide Caution Advisory signs be maintained. 

7/19/21-Samples were collected by Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board Staff on 7/8/21 as part of an ongoing Special Study. Levels of microcystin were detected at or just below the caution level. Due to the results as well as visual observations we recommend that you continue to maintain the Caution Advisory. 

6/25/21: Water monitoring conducted on 6/17 confirmed cyanobacteria bloom and low levels of cyanotoxins. Caution advisory continues. 

6/15: Water monitoring conducted on 6/2 confirmed cyanobacteria bloom and low levels of cyanotoxins. Caution advisory continues.

WaterBodyName: Pentachaeta Creek at Lindero Canyon Rd bridge, downstream of Westlake Lake
IncidentInformation:
3/18/2021: Dept of Fish and Wildlife and the upstream water manager conducted investigations. Based on results from water testing at the end of Feb., the discoloration of the water is due to a non-cyanobacteria bloom of diatoms (type of algae). DFW staff will be returning to the site this week to monitoring conditions. 

2/17/2021: Resident along Pentachaeta Creek submitted report of potential spill or HAB in the creek. The creek water became discolored (ranging from gray, blue-green, and white) since 2/9. The CA Dept. of Fish and Wildlife and Regional Water Board are coordinating an investigation. It appears not to be a potential algal bloom.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Pentachaeta Creek at Lindero Canyon Rd bridge, downstream of Westlake Lake

IncidentInformation: 3/2/21-Santa Ana Water Board Staff sampled at Big Bear Lake on February 17, 2021. Results indicate levels of Microcystin and Cylindrospermopsin both of which were under Caution levels.

WaterBodyName: Big Bear Lake-Boyer Public Launch Ramp
IncidentInformation:
7/30/21-Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff sampled on 7/27/21 as part of the Harmful Algal Bloom Special study. Results detected levels of microcystin that are within the Caution Advisory. Staff are recommending that a Lake-wide Caution Advisory be maintained. 

07/2/21-Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board Staff took samples on 6/22/21 as part of the ongoing HABs Special Study. Levels of microcystin were detected. Due to the visual indicators as well as the levels of QPCR, staff reccommends a lake-wide Caution Advisory be posted.   
  
03/02/21-Santa Ana Water Board staff sampled Big Bear Lake on February 17, 2021.  Surface water concentrations were at non detect. However the algal mat sample collected along shoreline resulted in Microcystin concentrations above the Caution level. Cylindrospermopsin was also detected.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Big Bear Lake-Boyer Public Launch Ramp

WaterBodyName: Brannan Island State Rec Area boat dock
IncidentInformation:
3/5/2021: A site investigation by Central Valley Regional Board staff saw no visible indicators of cyanobacteria at the boat ramp at Threemile Slough. No advisory recommended.

On 3/2/2021, the Water Boards was informed of a potential HAB-related dog illness as Brannan Island State Recreation Area. The incident occurred on 2/7/2021. Sample collection is being coordinated by the State and Regional Boards. Caution advisory is recommended until investigation is complete.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Threemile Slough, Brannan Island State Recreation Area

IncidentInformation:
9/11/2021: Public submitted photos of a bloom to the bloomWatch app. Caution advisory still recommended due ot visual observation of a bloom.

8/26/2021: Water sample collected on 8/15 as part of pre-holdiay assessment at the boat dock, skate park and bridge access. Water testing confirmed presence of moderatly high cyanobacteria by microscope. Cyanotoxins were below recreational trigger levels. The bloom consists of Azolla (type of water plant) and cyanobacteria. Due to visible indicators of a bloom, recommend continued caution advisory.

5/25/2021: Monitoring conducted for pre-holiday assessment. Water sample collected at boat dock, skate park and bridge access. Water testing confirmed presence of moderatly high cyanobacteria by microscope. Cyanotoxins were below recreational trigger levels. Due to visible indicators of a bloom, recommend continued caution advisory.

3/23/2021: Samples collected from 3/14 confirmed the presence of cyanobacteria in Lake El Estero. The cyanotoxin, cylindrospermopsin, was measured at concentrations below recreational trigger levels. Because there are visible indicators of a bloom, and bloom toxicity can change, a Caution advisory is recommended. Water Boards and City of Monterey are coordinating follow up monitoring for summer 2021.

Water in Lake El Estero is green and cyanobacterial filaments hav e been microscopically identified. The Water Boards is coordinating sample collection. Caution advisory until water sample results are received.

WaterBodyName: Combie lake, near confluence of Bear River
IncidentInformation:
3/12/2021: Nevada County irrigation district staff conducted a visual assessment of Combie Lake on 3/11 and did not find any algal biomass or bloom. No advisory.

On 3/11/2021 the Water Boards was notified by Placer County Environmental Health of accumulations of organic matter near the confluence with Bear River. The Central Valley Regional Board is coordinating field sampling to determine if this is algae. Caution advisory until field investigation is completed.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Combie Lake, near confluence with Bear River

IncidentInformation:
On 8/23/21 samples were taken and had the presence of the toxin Microcystin at 0.16 ug/L at a level below the Caution Trigger Level (0.8 ug/L). No advisory recommended.

7/1/21- San Bernardino County Parks reported visual indicators of a bloom and sampled on 7/1/21. Lab results from sample collected on 7/1 showed cyanotoxins at non-detect. Water Board Staff recommends posting a caution advisory due to site indicators of a harmful algal bloom and environmental conditions.

6/14/2021: Samples were collected. Cyanobacteria were detected but all toxins came back non-detect. 

5/25/21:Monitoring found no visible indicators of a bloom. The lab results detected low amounts of Oscillatoria cyanobacteria by microscope but no toxins were detected. No advisory at this time, recommend follow up monitoring.

4/23/21: Ambient monitoring was performed here on 4/19/21. Cyanobacteria were detected but all toxins came back non-detect. 

It was determined that dog did not become ill due to the water at this lake. 

A dog was reported ill after visiting Lake Gregory in late February. Initial report did not describe an algal bloom. HAB-related Illness Work Group is conducting investigation to determine if there is a bloom.

11/26/2021: Additional report submitted providing photo documentation of a bloom located on private property. Water Boards is coordinating an investigation. 

4/6/2021: Report submitted observing high abundance of algae and potential cyanobacteria in Maxwell creek and on stream pond. Water Boards is coordinating an investigation.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Maxwell Creek, near Pool Station Rd.

WaterBodyManager: US Bureau of Reclamation, CA-Great Basin Region
IncidentInformation:
4/16/2021: Field investigation by CA Fish and Wildlife staff did not observe any elevated cyanobacterial biomass or dead fish. No advisory. 

4/8/2021: Report submitted observing likely cyanobacteria bloom in Pit River arm. Also, observed fish kill in the area involving trout. The Water Boards is coordinating a site investigation with the water manager. Caution recommended.

WaterBodyName: Lake Tahoe North shore near Bristlecone Beach (near Tahoe City)
IncidentInformation:
4/23/21: Results from sample collected on 4/19/21 indicate no cyanobacteria cells.  

4/19/2021: On 4/16 the Water Boards received photographs of floating algal mats at near Bristlecone Beath. On 4/19 Regional Board staff sampled the mats and sent them for cyanotoxin analyses. We recommend avoiding accumulations of algal material, especially for dogs and children. Caution advisory.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Lake Tahoe North shore near Bristlecone Beach (near Tahoe City)

IncidentInformation:
The Tahoe Keys Lagoons are being monitored monthly through a collaborative effort between Lahontan Water Board and Tahoe Keys Property Owners Association (TKPOA). 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
11/19/21: four sites were sampled on 11/10. All samples contained cyanobacteria, but genes that have the ability to produce toxins were not present. No advisory recommended.

10/22/2021: four sites were sampled on 10/12. All samples were non-detect. No advisory recommended. 

9/24/2021: four sites were sampled on 9/14. Microcystins and anatoxin-a were present. The highest level of microcystins was 2.73 ug/L; and 0.41 ug/L for anatoxin-a. Both cyanotoxins were above the recommended caution advisory trigger level. Caution recommended. 

8/20/2021: four sites were sampled on 8/10. Cyanotoxins were present in low levels for microcystins. The results were below the recommended caution advisory trigger level. We need two weeks of data with no advisory in order to depost. Caution is still recommended.

On 7/20/21 TKPOA sampled the four locations. Microcystin/Nod. Was detected at three of the locations below the cautionary trigger level of .8 ug/L. Anatoxin-a was detected at three locations which warrants a Caution Advisory. 

7/23/2021: Six sites were sampled on 7/14. Lab results from microscopy showed low to moderate amount of the cyanobacteria Dolichospermum sp. As the dominant species. qPCR analysis was not performed. 

6/15/21: All four sampled locations contained a low to moderate amount of the cyanobacteria Dolichospermum sp. QPCR analysis on the samples containing cyanobacteria did not indicate toxin producing cells, as such, toxin analysis was not performed.

5/11/21: Sample locations F and H indicate no cyanobaceria cells. Location 6 contained a low amount of Trichodesmium, but all toxins were non-detect. Location I contained a low amount of Aphanocapsa, but all toxins were non-detect. 

4/13/21: Results indicate no toxins detected.

WaterBodyName: Prado Park Lake, Prado Regional Park
IncidentInformation:
SB County conducts routine monitoring at Prado Regional Park lakes. Monitoring results for this location is provide below.
------------------------------------------------------
6/15/2021: Samples were collected at the north channel and the boatdock in the south area. Analytical results showed non-detect for 4 cyanotoxins at boatdock and non-detect for 3 of 4 cyanotoxins at north channel. Microcystins were present but below the advisory threshold. No advisory recommended

5/21/2021: Regional Park staff reported large fish kill at Prado Park lake. The Water Boards is coordinating a field investigation and water sample collection. This report will be updated when results are available.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Prado Park Lake, Prado Regional Park

IncidentInformation:
11/4/2021: Given the weather, recent runoff and time of year, the Water Boards recommends removing the Toxic Algae Alert signs. No postings. 

6/11/2021: Water Boards staff conducted monitoring and collected algal mats for testing. Low levels of cylindrospermopsin and moderate levels of microcystins detected. Due to the presence of toxic algal mats and presence of mats accumulating along the shoreline on the western portion of the estuary, toxic algae alert signs (yellow) are recommended.

5/21/2021: Laboratory results detected cylindrospermopsin (0.07 ug/L); this is below trigger levels. However, due to high abundance of cyanobacteria and visual indicators, CAUTION advisory is still recommended. 

5/13/2021: Sonoma County Public Health collected water grab samples for ELISA analysis at three (3) sample locations. Sample results are pending. CAUTION signs were posted at eight (8) locations.

5/12/2021: According to the original complainant, the bloom is located in Salmon Creek Lagoon. The best access is to walk slightly north from the South Salmon Creek parking lot at the western end of Bean Ave. 

Sonoma County Public Health was notified.

5/21/2021: In early May, the Waterboards received a notification of potential water discoloration. Waterboards collected samples on 5/14/2021. Microscopic analysis did not identify any cyanobacteria in the water samples. No advisory.

WaterBodyName: Clear Lake across from Konocti Harbor
IncidentInformation:
5/28/2021: Update. Water testing results detected elevated microcystins. Recommend warning advisory. Posting will be coordinated with local agencies. 

5/17: On 5/12, the Water Boards received notification of bloom near Konocti Harbor. Samples were collected on 5/13, and advisory will be updated when laboratory results are received. Caution advisory.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Clear Lake, Monitor Point, across from Konocti Harbor

IncidentInformation:
05/25/2021: Samples collected on 5/19 had very abundant cyanobacteria (Microcystins and Dolichospermum). Caution advisory.

5/13/2021: Photos submitted show cyanbacteria bloom. No sampling conducted to determine cyanotoxin levels. Recommend caution advisory posting.

08/30/2021: Samples collected on 8/23 did not contain cyanobacteria, and cyanotoxins were not detected. No advisory.

07/01/2021: Samples collected on 6/21 did not contain cyanobacteria. No toxins detected. No advisory.

05/24/2021: Lab results received. No cyanobacteria present, and no cyanotoxins detected.

05/18/2021: No obvious cyanobacteria bloom observed on 5/17.

WaterBodyName: Los Penasquitos Creek at the falls
IncidentInformation:
08/30/2021: Samples collected on 8/23 contained a very small amount of Geitlernema sp. Saxitoxin was detected (0.02 ug/L) at the reporting limit. No advisory.

07/01/2021: Samples collected on 6/21 did not contain cyanobacteria.  Saxitoxin was detected (0.02 ug/L) at the detection limit. No advisory.

05/24/2021: Lab results available. No cyanobacteria present, and no cyanotoxins detected.

05/18/2021: Potential cyanobacteria crust present on rocks in stream. Samples collected.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Los Penasquitos Creek, at the falls

IncidentInformation:
11/29/2021: Samples collected on 11/15 contained a moderately high amount of Plantothrix sp. Anatoxin-a, Cylindrospermopsin and Microcystins were not detected. Saxitoxin was detected at 0.02 ug/L. Caution advisory based on visual bloom.

11/15/2021: Samples were collected on 11/15 in response to satellite notification. The reservoir appeared to have a thick bloom of Planktothrix. A water grab was collected to be analyzed for species ID and the toxin suite. 

08/30/2021: Samples collected on 8/23 contained a high amount of Planktothrix sp., moderately low amount of Dolichosperum sp., and very low amount of Anabaenopsis sp. Anatoxin-a was detected at 0.29 ug/L. Microcystins (0.24 ug/L) and Saxitoxin (0.03 ug/L) were also present. Caution advisory.

07/01/2021: Samples collected on 6/21 contained a high amount of Planktothrix sp. and a moderately low amount of Dolichospermum sp. Saxitoxin was detected (0.03) at the detection limit. Advisory siggested due to large bloom presence. Caution Advisory.

05/24/2021: Sample collected on 5/17 contained a moderately high amount of Plantothrix sp. Microcystins were detected at low levels (0.16 ug/L). No advisory.

05/18/2021: No obvious cyanobacteria bloom on 5/17.

WaterBodyName: San Diego River at Old Mission Dam
IncidentInformation:
09/15/2021: Samples collected on 9/7 contained low amounts of cyanobacteria (Microcoleus and Oscillatoria). No toxins were detected. Caution sign will stay up until bloom subsides.

09/08/2021: Follow-up sampling was conducted on 9/7. A notable (spilled paint look) bloom was present (possibly microcystis) just upstream of the dam. pH was elevated (9.08). Caution signs had been placed near the dam and throughout Mission Trails Regional Park.

08/30/2021: A moderate amount of Limnoraphis sp. was detected in samples collected on 8/23. Anatoxin-a was detected at 0.40 ug/L, and Microcyctins (0.24 ug/L) and Saxitoxin (0.02 ug/L) were present. Caution advisory.

07/01/2021: Cyanobacteria were not observed in samples collected on 6/21. Saxitoxin was detected (0.03 ug/L) at the detection limit. No advisory.

05/24/2021: Sample collected on 5/17 contained a moderate amount of eukaryotic algae, and no cyanobacteria were observed. Micorcystins were detected at low levels (0.15 ug/L). No advisory.

05/18/2021: No obvious cyanobactreia bloom on 5/17
OfficialWaterBodyName: San Diego River, at Old Mission Dam

IncidentInformation:
3/2/2022: Community member reported observation of a HAB at this location continually since we last updated this report on 11/19/2021.  Water Boards is coordinating with the county health to pursue response to report. Caution advisory recommended at this time.

11/19/2021: Community member reported observation of heavy HAB for the past couple weeks and observed intermittent dead fish. Oakwood Lake is privately owned and has restricted public access. Recommend posting of caution advisory until water testing results are obtained by the water manager. Water Boards coordinating with the county health to pursue response to report. 

6/6: Lab results detected 3.4 ug/L microcystins and no other cyanotoxins. High density of toxin producing cyanobacteria confirmed by the lab. Recommend continued caution advisory at the privately owned lake. 

5/25: Regional Water Board staff conducted monitoring at lake and confirmed cyanobacteria bloom based on visual observation. Dense bloom with scum and film along the shorelines and less dense into the open water. Due to locked private docks and fencing, staff could not access the water for samples except for a site on the eastern end. Water sample collected, this report will be updated with lab results when available.

On 5/13/2021 report submitted describing bloom along shorelines of lake and odors. Also, described some dead wildlife (fish). Water Boards are coordinating field visit to confirm bloom and collect water samples for testing.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Oakwood lake, eastern end private dock

WaterBodyName: Yucaipa Regional Park-Bottom Lake, South West Corner
IncidentInformation:
8/27/21-Yucaipa Regional Park Staff conducted sampling as part of the Labor Day Holiday 2021 assessment on 8/18/21. Lab results detected a significant harmful algal bloom in Bottom Lake. Due to the small size of the park, Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board recommends a Danger Advisory sign posted for all three lakes. 

06/21/21: Yucaipa Regional Park Staff conducted sampling at the Bottom Lake  as part of the Independence Day Holiday 2021 assessment. No visible bloom was observed. Lab analysis did not detect Anatoxin-a, Cylindrospermopsin, Microcystin, or Saxitoxin. No postings recommended .

05/12/21: Yucaipa Regional Park Staff conducted sampling at the South West Corner of Bottom Lake as part of the Memorial Day Holiday 2021 assessment. No visible bloom was observed. Lab analysis did not detect Anatoxin-a, Cylindrospermopsin, Microcystin, or Saxitoxin. No postings recommended.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Yucaipa Regional Park-Bottom Lake, South West Corner

Top Lake results detected antatoxin-a. Due to the small size of the park, Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board recommends a Danger Advisory sign posted for all three lakes. 

6/29/21 Yucaipa Regional Park Staff conducted sampling at the South East Corner of Top Lake  as part of the Independence Day Holiday 2021 assessment. No visible bloom was observed. Lab analysis did not detect Anatoxin-a, Cylindrospermopsin, Microcystin, or Saxitoxin. No postings recommended .

IncidentInformation:
6/21/21: Heenan was samples as part of the Independence day pre-holiday assessment. A very low amount of the cyanobacteria species Dolichospermum was observed under microscopic id. qPCR did non-detect any genes that have the potential to produce toxins. No advisory is recommended.

5/17/21- Heenan lake was sampled as part of the Memorial Day pre-holiday assessment. No cayanobacteria were observed in the sample.

WaterBodyManager: California Department of Fish and Wildlife
RecLandManager: California Department of Fish and Wildlife
IncidentInformation:
Red Lake is being monitored monthly through a collaborative effort between Lahontan Water Board and Alpine Watershed Group (AWG).
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10/1/2021: Multiple samples were collected at Red Lake on 9/21. Some of the samples had low abundance of microcystins but all below the trigger level for a caution advisory. No advisory recommended. 

8/26/2021: Multiple samples were collected at Red Lake on 8/16. Some of the samples had low abundance of microcystins but all below the trigger level for a caution advisory. No advisory recommended. 

7/23/2021: Multiple samples were collected at Red Lake on 7/12. Some of the samples had low abundance of microcystins but all beow the trigger level for a caution advisory. No advisory recommended. 

6/15/2021: Multiple samples were collected at Red Lake on 6/15. One sample had 0.53 ug/L microcystins which is below the trigger level for a caution advisory. No advisory.

5/17/21- CDFW monitored two locations as part of the Memorial Day pre-holiday assessment. Microscopy identification indicated no cyanobacteria at one sample location. The second location contained a low amount of the cyanobacteria species Aphanizomenon. QPCR analysis on the sample containing cyanobacteria did not indicate toxin producing cells, as such, toxin analysis was not performed.

8/26/2021: Sample collected on 8/15. Samples collected and lab testing confirmed moderate presence of cyanobacteria and <0.8 ug/L microcystins. Due to the discolored water and microscopy, caution recommended.

8/10/21: Planned water monitoring canceled due to azolla bloom (type of water plant) occuring lake-wide. 

5/25/21: Monitoring conducted for pre-holiday assessment. Samples collected and lab testing confirmed moderate presence of cyanobacteria and <0.8 ug/L microcystins. Due to the discolored water and microscopy, caution recommended.

5/25/2021: Monitoring conducted for holiday assessment. Water sample collected on western shore of lake near play ground. Water testing confirmed presence of cyanobacteria and cyanotoxins below detection levels. Due to the results and minor water discoloration, no advisory recommended at this time. 
Water Boards will coordinate sampling next month to monitor water conditions.

8/26/2021: Monitoring conducted for pre-holiday assessment. Water sample collected at park shoreline. Results detected micorystins at 0.20 ug/L. No advisory recommended.

5/25/2021: Monitoring conducted for pre-holiday assessment. Water sample collected at park shoreline. Water testing confirmed presence of cyanobacteria by microscope and cyanotoxins below recreational trigger levels. Due to visible cyanobacteria colonies in the water and dried algal material on the shoreline, caution advisory recommended.

8/25/2021: Monitoring conducted for pre-holiday assessment. Due to recent monitoring of lakes with outfalls to the bay, some sites in the bay were sampled. Two cyanotoxins were detected. Saxitoxin at 1.61 ug/L and cylindrospermopsin at 0.10 ug/L. Caution advisory recommended.

5/25/2021: Monitoring conducted for pre-holiday assessment. Due to recent monitoring of lakes with outfalls to the bay, some sites in the bay were sampled. Water testing did not detect cyanobacteria by microscope. Two cyanotoxins were detected below recreational trigger levels, anatoxin-a detected above trigger levels. Recommend caution advisory in the area.

WaterBodyName: Monterey public launch ramp, near Coast Guard dock
IncidentInformation:
8/26/2021: Monitoring conducted for pre-holiday assessment. Due to recent monitoring of lakes with outfalls to the bay, some sites in the bay were sampled. Two cyanotoxins were detected. Cylindrospermopsin at 0.09 ug/L and saxitoxin at 7.45 ug/L. Caution advisory recommended. 

5/25/2021: Monitoring conducted for pre-holiday assessment. Due to recent monitoring of lakes with outfalls to the bay, some sites in the bay were sampled. Water testing did not detect cyanobacteria by microscope. Anatoxin-a detected above recreational trigger levels, other cyanotoxins detected were below trigger levels. Recommend caution advisory.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Monterey public launch ramp, near Coast Guard dock

IncidentInformation: 5/25/2021: County conducted water monitoring for holiday assessment at a surface intake and boat house. No visual observations of a bloom were observed.

5/25/2021: Water manager conducting monitoring for the holiday assessment at multiple locations in the lake and the swim beach. No visible observations of a bloom were observed and Abraxis test strips were <2.5 ug/L microcystins.

WaterBodyName: Glen Helen Regional Park lake, boat dock
IncidentInformation: 5/25/2021: Regional Parks conducted pre-holiday monitoring at the lake. Water samples were collected near the boat dock. Visible bloom was confirmed. Water testing detected elevated microcystins concentration 99 ug/L. Lake-wide danger advisory is recommended and the Water Boards is coordinating the posting with local agencies.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Glen Helen Regional Park lake, boat dock

IncidentInformation:
Central Valley Regional Board is conducting a monitoring project at Eastman Lake from late May-late Fall. The results of the HAB monitoring are provided below. For any questions contact cyanoHAB.reports@waterboards.ca.gov. 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
11/10: Waterboard staff collected samples on 10/18. Total microsystins were 3.04 ppb. Caution advisory recommended based on these results.

11/8/21: Staff made visual and microscopic observations of this site on 11/1. Evidence of harmful cyanobacteria were still present. Danger advisory still recommended.

11/1/21: Staff made visual observations of this site. Evidence of harmful cyanobacteria were still present. Danger advisory still recommended.

10/15/21: 2 samples were collected on 10/4. Water sample results for the surface is ~ 6 ug/L microcystins and the scum samples have very elevated microcystins concentration greater than 3,000 ug/L. Recommend upgrading advisory to Danger and the Water Boards coordinating with local agencies to update the advisory at the lake. 

9/30/2021: A sample was collected on 9/20. Results show  microcystin at 1.80 ug/L and Saxitoxin present at 0.15 ug/L. Caution advisory recommended.

9/10/2021: A sample was collected on 9/01. Results show  microcystin present. One sample has microcystin [LA] present at 1.17 ug/L., microcystin [RR] present at 0.41 ug/L, and microcystin [LR] present at 0.66 ug/L.. Caution advisory recommended.

9/1/2021: Water sample was collected on western side of lake on 8/23. Lab results contained microcystins at 1.13 ug/L and saxitoxin at 0.042ug/L. Caution advisory recommended. 

8/20/2021: Water sample was collected on western side of lake on 8/9. Lab results contained microcystins at 0.89 ug/L and saxitoxin at 0.04 ug/L. Caution advisory recommended. 

6/23/2021: Water samples were collected on western side of lake on 6/14 and observations were not made on the eastern side. Green discoloration and suspected cyanobacteria bloom was reported. The lab confirmed cyanobacteria bloom by microscope. Recommend caution advisory to be posted and re-evaluated after cyanotoxin results are available.

5/25/2021: Water samples were collected on western side of lake on 5/18 and observations were not made on the eastern side. Green discoloration and suspected cyanobacteria bloom was reported. The lab confirmed cyanobacteria bloom by microscope. Recommend caution advisory to be posted and re-evaluated after cyanotoxin results are available.

Central Valley Regional Board is conducting a monitoring project at Eastman Lake from late May-late Fall. The results of the HAB monitoring are provided below. For any questions contact cyanoHAB.reports@waterboards.ca.gov. 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
11/8/21: Staff collected water samples at this site on 11/2. No toxin producing cyanobacteria were observed during field work at the lake or under a microscope in the lab. Indicators of a bloom have not been observed at this site since 9/30. No advisory recommended at this time.

11/2/21: Staff made visual observations of this site. No evidence of harmful cyanobacteria were  present.

9/30/21: Samples were collected on 9/21 for lab analysis. Sample had Cylindrospermopsin at 0.15 ug/L, Microcystin at 0.16 ug/L,  and Saxitotin at 0.22 ug/L. Anaxotin-a was below the detection threshold. Caution advisory recommended at this time based on visual indicators.

9/14/2021: Samples were collected on 9/8 for lab analysis. Sample had anaxotin-a at 0.92 ug/L. Caution advisory recommended.

9/02/2021: Samples were collected on 8/24 for lab analysis. Sample had microcystins at 0.93 ug/L, anaxotin-a at 0.39 ug/L, and saxitoxin at 0.07 ug/L. Caution advisory recommended.

8/20/2021: Samples were collected on 8/10 for lab analysis. Sample had microcystins at 0.14 ug/L and saxitoxin at 0.12 ug/L. Because visual observation of bloom, caution advisory recommended.

7/28/2021: The Central Valley Regional Water Board observed paint-like scum and cloudy, green water at this site on 7/27/2021. Caution advisory remains recommended based on observation. 

7/23/2021: The Central Valley Regional Water Board collected samples on 7/15/2021. Lab results showed Cyanotoxins below trigger thresholds. Caution advisory remains recommended based on previous observation.  

6/23/2021: Water samples were collected on western side of lake on 6/15. Green, soupy surface conditions were reported. Lab results confirmed moderate concentration of cyanobacteria by microscope and elevated chlorophyll-a. Recommend caution advisory to be posted and re-evaluated after cyanotoxins results are available.

5/25/2021: Water samples were collected on western side of lake on 5/18. Green, soupy surface conditions were reported. Lab results confirmed moderate concentration of cyanobacteria by microscope and elevated chlorophyll-a. Recommend caution advisory to be posted and re-evaluated after cyanotoxins results are available.

9/02/2021: Samples were collected on 8/24 for lab analysis. Sample had microcystins at 0.16 ug/L, anaxotin-a at 0.48 ug/L, and saxitoxin at 0.03 ug/L. Caution advisory recommended.

WaterBodyName: Lake Clementine, upper day use area/beach
RecLandManager: CA State Parks, Gold Fields District
IncidentInformation:
8/23/2021: State Parks conducted monitoring for the holiday assessment on 8/16. Algal mat sample was collected. Anatoxin-a was detected at 99.87 ug/L, other cyanotoxins non-detect. Algal mat is anatoxin-a levels were beyond the danger advisory level for planktonic HABs. Recommend posting toxic algae alert at minimum. 
Do not let children or adults touch, eat or swallow any algal mats.  Do not let dogs eat algal mats or from the water. Call your doctor or veterinarian immediately if you or your pet get sick after contacting or ingesting algae.

5/25/2021: State Parks conducted monitoring for the holiday assessment. Water sample was collected at beach. No visible signs of a bloom or algal mats were observed. Cyanotoxins were detected below recreational trigger levels. No advisory recommended.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Lake Clementine, upper day use area/beach

5/25/2021: State Parks conducted monitoring for the holiday assessment. Algal mat sample was collected. Extensive algal mats observe in channel and cobble. Anatoxin-a was detected 0.25 ug/L, other cyanotoxins non-detect. Recommend caution advisory, specifically toxic algae alert sign.

RecLandManager: CA State Parks, Gold Fields District
IncidentInformation:
8/24/2021: State Parks conducted monitoring for the holiday assessment. Scum sample was collected, indicating dense bloom was present. Orange-brown scum was visible at the shoreline. Caution advisory recommended at this time. 

5/25/2021: State Parks conducted monitoring for the holiday assessment. Water sample was collected. No visible bloom observed at the site and low concentration of cyanobacteria detected by microscope. No advisory recommended at this time. Water Boards will coordinate follow up sampling to monitor conditions.

RecLandManager: CA State Parks, Gold Fields District
IncidentInformation:
8/25/2021: State Parks monitoring for the holiday assessment. No visible indicators of a bloom observed in lake along shoreline. Testing did not detect cyanotoxins, low density cyanobacteria observed by microscope. No advisory. 

5/25/2021: State Parks conducted monitoring for the holiday assessment. No visible indicators of a bloom observed in main lake. However, a water sample was collected from a isolated pool nearby the shore due to extensive algal material. Lab testing detected high amount of non-toxic green algae in sample and cyanotoxins were non-detect. Recommend no advisory.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Folsom Lake, Beals Point Day use/beach

IncidentInformation:
As part of the Freshwater Harmful Algal Bloom (HAB) Program's pre-holiday assessment, Friends of Gualala River collected water samples at Gualala River. Lab results are provided below for samples collected at this site.

8/24/2021: Low level anatoxins (0.29 ug/L) were detected in algal mats. Educational Check for Algae have been posted. No advisory. 

7/1/2021: Water Boards staff collected algal mats for testing. Low levels of anatoxins (0.26 ug/L) were detected. Educational Check for Algae signs have been posted. No advisory.

6/22/2021: Lab results were below detection limits for all cyanotoxins. General awareness signs have been posted in the area. No advisory. 

5/26/2021: Lab results did not detect cyanotoxins. No blooms were observed. No advisory.

As part of the Freshwater Harmful Algal Bloom (HAB) Program's pre-holiday assessment, Friends of Gualala River collected water samples at Gualala River. Lab results are provided below for samples collected at this site.

6/22/2021: Lab results were below detection limits for all cyanotoxins. General awareness signs have been posted in the area. No advisory. 

5/26/2021: Lab results did not detect cyanotoxins. No blooms were observed. No advisory.

As part of the Freshwater Harmful Algal Bloom (HAB) Program's pre-holiday assessment, Waterboard staff collected water samples at Pillsbury Lake. Lab results are provided below for samples collected at this site.

8/27/2021: Regional Board staff sampled on 8/23. Anatoxins (0.32 ug/L) and saxitoxins (0.17 ug/L) were detected. Visual appearance of a bloom.CAUTION posting recommended.

7/1/2021: Follow-up monitoring did not detect any cyanotoxins. However, a CAUTION is still recommended until two consecutive samples are non-detect. 

6/23/2021: Lab results detected anatoxins (0.20 ug/L). According to voluntary guidance, Water Boards recommends posting a CAUTION.

5/26/2021: Lab results did not detect cyanotoxins. No blooms were observed. No advisory.

As part of the Freshwater Harmful Algal Bloom (HAB) Program's pre-holiday assessment, Waterboard staff collected water samples at Pillsbury Lake. Lab results are provided below for samples collected at this site.

8/27/2021: Regional Board staff sampled on 8/23. Anatoxins (0.30 ug/L) and saxitoxins (0.13 ug/L) were detected. Visual appearance of a bloom. CAUTION posting recommended.

7/1/2021: Follow-up sampling did not detect any cyanotoxins. Water Boards still recommends a CAUTION for the lake until two consecutive sampling events at Lake Pillsbury Resort are non-detect.

6/23/2021: Lab results did not detect cyanotoxins at this site, and no blooms were observed. However, anatoxins were detected at Lake Pillsbury Resort. As a result, a CAUTION is recommended for the lake.

5/26/2021: Lab results did not detect cyanotoxins. No blooms were observed. No advisory.

As part of the Freshwater Harmful Algal Bloom (HAB) Program's pre-holiday assessment, Blue Lake Rancheria collected water samples in Mad River. Lab results are provided below for samples collected at this site.

8/27/2021: Anatoxins were detected (1.08 ug/L) in algal mat samples. Moderate amounts of cyanobacteria were also identified. Water Boards recommends a benthic Toxic Algae Alert (CAUTION) posting. 

6/22/2021: No toxins were detected, but toxic algal mats observed. Waterboards recommends a CAUTION.

5/26/2021: Lab results detected anatoxin (0.90 ug/L) and low levels of cylindrospermopsins (0.08 ug/L). Because anatoxins were detected, Waterboards recommends a CAUTION.

As part of the Freshwater Harmful Algal Bloom (HAB) Program's pre-holiday assessment, Blue Lake Rancheria collected water samples in Mad River. Lab results are provided below for samples collected at this site.

8/27/2021: Anatoxins were detected (3.09 ug/L) in algal mat samples. Moderate amounts of cyanobacteria were also identified. Water Boards recommends a benthic Toxic Algae Alert (CAUTION) posting. 

6/22/2021: Lab results detected anatoxin (1.11 ug/L). Visual indicators of a bloom present. Waterboards recommends a CAUTION.

5/26/2021: Lab results detected anatoxin (1.09 ug/L). Because anatoxins were detected, Waterboards recommends a CAUTION.

As part of the Freshwater Harmful Algal Bloom (HAB) Program's pre-holiday assessment, Trinity County Environmental Health staff collected water samples at Ruth Lake. Lab results are provided below for samples collected at this site.

5/26/2021: Lab results did not detect cyanotoxins. Field observations noted algal mats at the sampling site and microscopy confirmed cyanobacteria. Waterboards recommends posting General Awareness signs.

WaterBodyName: Glen Helen Regional Park, Small Lake
IncidentInformation:
8/27/21-Glen Helen Regional Park Staff sampled on 8/19/21 as part of the Labor Day 2021 Holiday Assessment. Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff are recommending a Caution Advisory due to the levels of Anatoxin-a detected. 

6/17/21-Glen Helen Regional Park Staff sampled as part of the 2021 Independence Day Holiday Assessment.  There was no detection of Microcystin at Small Lake. No Caution Advisory recommended. 

5/13/21 San Bernardino Regional Park Staff sampled Small Lake as part of the Memorial Day Holiday Assessment. Microcystin levels were at .15 ug/L which is below the the Caution Advisory of the Trigger Levels for Human and Animal Health. As a result, Waterboard staff do not recommend any advisories be posted at this time.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Glen Helen Regional Park, Small Lake

IncidentInformation:
South Tahoe Public Utility District performs regular monitoring of Indian Creek Reservoir, and also partners with Lahontan Water Board during the pre-holiday assessments to perform sampling at three locations.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
8/19/21- Two sample locations indicate the presence of the toxin Microcystin above the caution trigger level of 0.8 ug/L. Caution is advised.

6/21/21- Microscopy identification indicated low  to moderate amounts of the cyanobacteria species Woronichinia and Snowella. QPCR analysis on two of the samples did not indicate toxin producing cells, as such, toxin analysis was not performed. One sample contained cells that have the ability to produce the toxin Microcystin and ELISA showed it at the level of 0.32 ug/L which is below the caution trigger level of 0.8 ug/L. No Advisory

5/19/21- Microscopy identification indicated no cyanobacteria at one sample location. The other two locations contained low amounts of the cyanobacteria species Woronichinia and Dolichospermum. QPCR analysis on the samples containing cyanobacteria did not indicate toxin producing cells, as such, toxin analysis was not performed.

WaterBodyName: Gualala River, Beach near River Mouth
RecLandManager: Mendocino and Sonoma Counties Environmental Health
IncidentInformation:
11/4/2021: Given the weather, recent runoff and time of year, the Water Boards recommends removing the educational Check for Algae signs. No postings. 

8/24/2021: Samples were collected as part of the Water Boards pre-holiday assessment. Low level cylindrospermopsin (0.37 ug/L) and microcystins (0.84 ug/L) were detected in algal mats. Educational Check for Algae have been posted. No advisory. 

7/1/2021: Water Boards staff collected algal mats for testing. Low levels of anatoxins (0.25 ug/L) were detected. Educational Check for Algae have been posted. No advisory. 

6/11/2021: Water Boards staff conducted monitoring and collected algal mats for testing. Low levels of cylindrospermopsin and microcystins detected below caution trigger levels. Due to the possibility of toxin producing algal mats, algae mat general awareness sign recommended to be posted. 

6/11/2021: Investigation due to report of suspected dog illness discontinued since no info was provided by the reporting party to identify the dog owner.

5/26/2021: Waterboards staff received a complaint of abundant algae and a potential dog illness at the Gualala River beach near the river mouth. Waterboards is gathering more information and sampling date to be determined. Environmental Health departments in the area have been notified. Due to the suspected dog illness, Waterboards is recommending a CAUTION.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Gualala River, Beach near River Mouth

WaterBodyName: Lake Elsinore, Launch Pointe NE dock end
IncidentInformation:
12/29/2021: Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board sapled on 12/21/2021. Due do the levels of microcystin detected staff recommends a lake-wide Caution Advisory be maintained.

12/15/2021: Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board sampled on 12/07/2021. The levels of microcystin decreased from the Warning Advisory to the Caution advisory. Due to the results, staff recommend a lake-wide Caution advisory be posted. 

11/30/2021: Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff sampled on 11/18/2021. The levels of microcystin decreased from the Danger level to the Warning advisory. Due to the results, we currently recommend a lake-wide Warning advisory be posted.  

11/10/2021: Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff sampled on 11/2/21. The levels of microcystin increased since the last sampling event. Due to the results we currently recommend a lake-wide Danger Advisory be posted.  
11/3/2021: Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff sampled on 10/21/2021. The levels of microcystin and cylindrospermopsin have increased. Due to the results we currently recommend a lake-wide Caution Advisory be maintained.  


10/19/2021: Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff sampled on 10/07/2021. Due to the results including the detection of Anatoxin-a, a Lake-Wide Caution Advisory  has been recommended.  

9/30/2021: Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Boar staff sampled on 9/21/21 as part of the Lake Elsinore HABs Special Study. Microcystin levels have decreased and therefore, a Lake-Wide Caution Advisory has been recommended. 

9/17/2021: Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Boar staff sampled on 9/9/21 as part of the Lake Elsinore HABs Special Study. Microcystin levels have increased and therefore, a Lake-Wide Warning Advisory has been recommended. 
9/2/2021: Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff sampled on 08/24/21 as part as the Lake Elsinore HABs Special Study. Water Boards recommend that the Lake-wide Caution Advisory signs be maintained. 

08/12/2021 Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board staff sampled on 08/05/21 as part as the Lake Elsinore HABs Special Study. Microcystin levels continue to be within the Caution advisory but the data is trending towards the Warning advisory. We currently recommend that the Lake-wide Caution Advisory signs be maintained. 

7/30/21 The Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board sampled on 7/22/21. The microcystin results were above the Caution threshold set by the Trigger Levels for Humans and Animal Health. We recommend that the Lake-wide Caution Advisory be maintained.

7/19/21-Samples were collected by Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board Staff on 7/8/21 as part of an ongoing Special Study. Levels of microcystin were detected at or just below the caution level. Due to the results as well as visual observations we recommend that you continue to maintain the Caution Advisory. 

6/25/21- Samples were collected by Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board Staff on 6/17/21 as part of an ongoing Special Study. The toxin concentrations were below the Caution level threshold but due to  visual indicators, staff recommend that the lake-wide Caution Advisory be maintained. 

6/2/21- Samples were collected by Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board Staff on 6/2/21 as part of an ongoing Special Study. The toxin concentrations were below the Caution level threshold but due to  visual indicators, staff recommend that the lake-wide Caution Advisory be maintained. Additionally, Prymnesium, or golden algae genes were detected in both samples.
5/28/21-Samples were collected by Santa Ana Regional Water Quality Control Board Staff on 5/18/21 as part of an ongoing Special Study. Due to  visual indicators, staff recommend that the lake-wide Caution Advisory be maintained.
OfficialWaterBodyName: Lake Elsinore, Launch Pointe NE dock end

IncidentInformation:
The California Department of Water Resources (CA DWR) monitors the State Water Project facilities for cyanobacteria and cyanotoxins.  This is one of the monitoring locations.  Results of the monitoring are listed below.For more information, contact Maggie Macias, DWR Information Officer, (916) 653-8743.
----------------------------------------------
9/07/2021: Water was sampled on 8/30/2021 by Department of Water Resources staff. Lab did not detect cyanotoxins. No advisory.

8/31/2021: Water was sampled on 8/23/2021 by Department of Water Resources staff. Lab did not detect cyanotoxins. No advisory.

8/6/2021: Water was sampled on 7/26/2021 by Department of Water Resources staff. Lab did not detect cyanotoxins. No advisory.

7/23/2021: Water was sampled on 7/20/2021 by Department of Water Resources staff. Lab did not detect cyanotoxins. No advisory.
